items.title: Information Security Cloud Governance Professional- Remote potential
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
$30 Billion global corporation with over 30,000 employees is looking for a strong Cloud Security professional as a direct hire employee.

This role can be done at a few of their regional offices or be home-based.

Key Responsibilities

Work closely with Application Development, Cloud, Governance, and Compliance teams to help formulate and implement a strategy for cloud based security that is tailored to the specific risks facing the organization, including threat modelling and applications security advisement services.
Develop and maintain a balanced cloud security governance framework based on industry standards
Ensure compliance with society, regulatory, and industry standards for cloud based security.
Continuously evaluate the organizations existing cloud security practices, define and measure security-related activities, and demonstrating improvements to the cloud programs within the organization.

Job Qualifications

Relevant postsecondary education and/or industry standard certifications preferred (ie, CompTIA, Microsoft, EC-Council, ISACA, ISC2, SANS Institute/GIAC, EMC, Amazon, VMware), AWS Certified Solutions Architect, CompTIA Cloud+ Certification, CISSP, Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK)
5+years of experience in secure application/platform development and security
3+ years of project management, consulting, and/or application security analyst experience
Experience with establishing cloud security governance across an organization
Thorough knowledge of common application vulnerabilities (eg OWASP Top 10), attack techniques and remediation tactics/strategies
Passion for Agile/XP/Scrum/Kanban, Test Driven Development built on User Stories and Continuous Integration/Testing/Delivery

items.title: Ping Access IAM Solution Architect - Remote, Identity and Access Manag
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Identity and Access Management/IAM Solution Architect candidates will have experience with Ping Access. Candidates will ideally come from a software development background. We will entertain candidates from either end user or service provider backgrounds. This role is remote with travel so candidates can be based anywhere in the US.

Location - Virtual-Remote-Telecommute - 35% national travel
Starting salary $100,000 to $120,000+ per year, Also part of the comp package are full time health benefits along with significant career progression opportunity.

This is a permanent position working for a leading Cyber Security Solution provider servicing large enterprise organizations and US Government agencies.

In this Identity and Access Management Solution Architect position you will be the primary customer interface and technical authority with regard to IAM products and solutions.

Duties and Responsibilities
-Provides technical design and consulting services on (IAM) Identity and Access Management (IAM) products
-Provides customer specific though leadership and solution construction including installations of Identity and Access Management (IAM) products for User life cycle management, Identity and Access Governance, Automated Provisioning, (SSO) Single Sign-On, Federation, and Privileged Account Management
-Enhances existing systems by analysing business objectives, preparing an action plan and identifying areas for modification and improvement
-Creates customer level documentation specific to deployment of IAM products
-Creates knowledge articles for corporate website related to IAM
-Provide regular feedback to the Professional Services Director to guide systems integration methodology and packages service development

Technical Experience and Qualifications
-Experience with Ping Access
-Lead customer-focused discussions and interact with our customers as the primary technical authority for an engagement
-Ability to present project solutions to clients, manage client expectations, and implement and deliver solutions
-Become a subject matter expert with IAM products and concepts
-Web Application security
-Software Security
-HTTP and related technologies
-Database/Directory integration
-x509 Certificates
-Windows, Unix, Linux
-Experience with some combination of IAM products: Radiant Logic, Sailpoint, Centrify, ForgeRock, Ping Access, Ping Identity/Ping ID/PingID, PingFederate, IBM, Okta, Oracle, RSA, simeio
-Federated Identity and Single Sign-On
-Access Management and API Gateways
-SAML, WS-Federation, OAuth, OpenID Connect, and/or SCIM standards
-RADIUS and/or KERBEROS
-APIs (SOAP, XML, REST, JSON)
-Social APIs including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.
-User Directory (Active Directory OpenLDAP, OpenDJ, etc.)
-Java and/or .NET development
-Amazon's AWS services (ie VPCs, SES, RC2, R3, Route 53, Cloud Formation, etc.)

items.title: ServiceNow Solution Architect - REMOTE opportunity
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
• This position is available as a remote opportunity for the right candidate.

  • Understanding of ServiceNow Architecture as well as best practices from experience and Awareness of upgrade-safe approaches

  • Implementations of ITSM ( Incident, Problem, Change, CMDB, Service Catalog) ,at least one of each

  • Experience in Scripting, Service Portal, Performance Analytics, Integrations

  • Application Suites : ITSM (Required), ITBM (Preferred), ITOM (Desired), Custom Applications (Desired)

  • Certifications: Certified ServiceNow Administrator (Required), Certified ServiceNow Application Developer (Preferred)

Essential Functions:

  • Provide technical leadership for the portfolio of applications managed by an IT Service Owner.
  • Drive the usability and quality of the software developed within the area.
  • Ensure technical currency is maintained within the applications within the portfolio.
  • Be a hands-on software engineer who can write quality code, assist with problem solving, root cause analysis, trouble shooting and coaching.
  • Write technical blogs and be active in Open Source Community.

Agile, DevOPS and Cloud:

  • Apply Design Thinking techniques on application design.
  • Lead agile software development efforts as a senior Technical Leader.
  • Coach and mentor other software engineers across teams on practices such as TDD, ATDD and pair programming.
  • Design highly scalable applications in AWS cloud using tools like Cloud Formation Templates, EC2, SWF, ELB, Lambda, S3, RDS/Dynamo DB and others.
  • Create load and performance testing strategy and perform advanced performance tuning.
  • Review and implement corrective and preventive measures based on metrics across portfolio of applications including but not limited to code quality, business metrics and performance metrics.

General Job Information

Title

ServiceNow Solution Architect - Sr. Consulting SE

Grade

29

Job Family

Info Technology Group

Country

United States of America

FLSA Status

United States of America (Exempt)

Recruiting Start Date

8/20/2018

Date Requisition Created

8/7/2018

Minimum Qualifications

Education

Bachelors Computer and Information Science

License and Certifications - Required

License and Certifications - Preferred

Other Job Requirements

Responsibilities

  • 8+ years of related experience including experience working with Agile Methods and modern programming environments.
  • Experience in health care, insurance or related field.
  • Critical thinker.
  • Demonstrated problem solving techniques.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Magellan Health Services is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Tobacco-free workplace. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled

items.title: Appian Solutions Designer (Onsite/Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
NEW POSITION!! Send in your resume along with salary expectation, availability, and contact information ASAP.

Company Profile

Kyra Solutions, Inc. is a premier Information Technology Consulting Organization established in 1997 and headquartered in Lakeland, Florida. Kyra is a prime vendor of the State of Florida and provides high quality IT Consulting Services to its clients. Kyra has been in the IT Industry for 20 years and has been serving the IT Public Sector within the State of Florida for the past 15 years. The company has won numerous awards for its aggressive growth and quality of project execution; which include:

  • Florida's _ Best Companies To Work For _ 2014 & 2015
  • State's Diversity Business of the Year
  • America's Fastest Growing Private Companies - Inc. 5000
  • Tampa Bay Fast 50

Contact Information

Email:

Job Description

Job Title: Appian Solutions Designer in Brooksville, FL (Onsite/Remote) Duration: Short Term

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • 5 plus years of software development experience.
  • Four (4) plus years of experience working with Appian.
  • Ten (10) successful Appian projects completed.
  • Silver Certified (A-Score above 20).
  • Appian Lead Designer Credential.
  • Appian Analyst Credential.
  • Expert knowledge in use of Appian SDK, APIs and web services.
  • The ability to provide expert technical leadership for the Appian Development team following Appian Best Practices.
  • The ability to architect and design Appian BPM complex applications that meet the end-users' requirements and follow Appian Best Practices including process modeling, user interface design, integration with external systems and data modeling. The designed BPM system should improve current business processes where possible.
  • The ability to complete design reviews of the project team deliverables to ensure adherence to Appian Best Practices.
  • The ability to mentor Junior Appian designers and analysts (District staff).
  • Possess deep working knowledge or experience in multiple related technologies, such as Operating Systems, Application Servers, Web Servers, Databases, Webservices and Java.
  • The ability to work in an Agile team environment.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Kyra recruiters, know the industry landscape and our clients' needs well. We also understand you want not only a high wage position but long-term growth potential. Our employees have over a 93% renewal rate while employed with us. We work hard to not only keep you working but growing with more challenging issues in need of innovative solutions.

If you are interested in this position or in working for Kyra in the future, please send us your resume with salary expectation, availability, and contact information. We look forward to hearing from you soon!

Background / References

Verifiable Professional References will be required along with the resume, however, references will be checked/contacted after the interview and before the project starts.

Background check (for past 10 years) will be done on the selected candidate for Employment, Criminal (State & Federal), Education, and others as mandated by the client. Please make sure your resume and all other information provided are accurate. Any misrepresentation will mean permanent disqualification by the client.

Equal employment opportunity employer.

  • provided by Dice Appian, Appian SDK, Appian API, Appian Best Practices, Appian BPM, Process Modeling, User Interface Design, Data Modeling, Databases, Java, Agile, Operating Systems, Web Services, Application Servers

items.title: Servicenow Solutions Architect - Remote
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
A leading Management Consulting firm specializing in providing business and technical expertise to clients across industries is now hiring a SERVICENOW Architect to work remote. Client has been named a top 10 firm to work for by Consulting Magazine for 6 of the past 7 years.

Duties:

· Provide subject matter expertise, act as technical product advocate, design, develop and implement ITIL processes, ITSM, ITAM, SACM, Knowledge, Demand and Release Management modules within ServiceNow platform.

· Implement technology specific best practices and standards.

· Researches and evaluates alternative solutions and recommends the most efficient and cost-effective solutions.

· Proposes data model, design changes to processes and products, exerts significant latitude in determining objectives of an assignment.

· Translates requirements into functional and technical requirements.

· Designs and develops extensions to Service Now data model in support of requirements towards CMDB, SACM and other modules.

· Reviews and refines designs for usability, review testing scenarios and refines test cases, to ensure applications quality and works with users to review test results to ensure they meet expected results Support and coordinate scheduling and execution of releases, product upgrades, new technology deployments.

· Evaluation of new features and produce comprehensive analysis and recommendations. Perform and participate in product roadmap planning.

· Produces and maintains detailed system documentation including design specs, maintenance, troubleshooting, deployment, disaster recovery, technotes, and testing, etc.

Qualifications:

·Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other related fields.

· Ten years of relative experience.

· Ability to work remotely and independently

· Practical experience with agile methodologies/tools Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to describe technical solutions in the terms of the business.

· Experience with leading geographically separated customers and onshore/offshore teams Interact cross-functionally on matters that require coordination across the organization and collaborates well with other groups, voluntarily shares information.

  • provided by Dice ServiceNow

items.title: Solutions Engineer
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
Solutions Engineer

Developer
Anywhere in US
Company: Rainforest QA
Full Time

Overview

 It’s our mission to enable development teams to deliver bug-free software while moving at the speed of continuous delivery. Our headquarters are in the heart of San Francisco’s financial district but we are truly a global team, allowing us to bring together the best and most diverse talent. Our commitment to the distributed team model and to our company values has earned usand helped us build a diverse team of individuals working toward the same goal: change the way QA is done.

Rainforest QA is an on-demand QA solution.  multiple culture and workplace awards

Learn more about Rainforest QA by visiting our , , , and LinkedInGlassdoorInstagramFacebook pages.

Solutions Engineer

As a Solutions Engineer at Rainforest QA you’ll architect solutions for customers, demonstrate proof of concepts, and work with sales throughout all aspects of the pre-sales customer journey. You’ll also use your expertise to build out the Sales Engineer function from scratch and partner with leaders across the organization on a regular basis to communicate customer requirements and product improvement ideas.

What you’ll do
  • Collaborate with Account Executives to identify and uncover customer business goals, needs, and pains, and work to show how RainforestQA can address them
  • Design, create, and present demos, and proofs of concept to a wide variety of business and technical stakeholders
  • Act as a technical subject matter expert for our platform at strategic conferences, Interactive customer events, webinars, etc.
  • Provide customer and market feedback to product and engineering team
  • Provide technical responses to RFPs and RFIs
  • Provide coaching to the customer facing teams to enhance their product knowledge, technical acumen, and technical sales skills

    • What we’re looking for
    • 3+ years of technical experience as a engineer, sales engineer, solutions architect, etc.
    • You feel comfortable leading presentations and demos of our platform to groups, both technical and non-technical, in-person and virtually
    • Deep understanding of the software development lifecycle
    • Broad ops/infrastructure knowledge, especially networking and security
    • Experience with QA and the various technologies (eg selenium, gherkin, etc.) that make up the stack

      • How we’ll reward you
      • Remote work options
      • Competitive compensation and stock options
      • 100% Medical, dental, and vision insurance covered (75% for dependents)
      • Voluntary 401 k program
      • Daily catered lunch and snacks
      • Subsidized commuter benefits
      • Generous vacation time
      • Professional development, in-office career coaching, and conference attendance
      • Dog friendly offices
      • Weekly team activities like happy hours, in-office yoga, and much more

        • OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION

        At Rainforest QA we believe that diverse teams improve our business. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

        To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://jobs.lever.co/rainforest/c2c09702-bddb-442c-9dc1-49b225fd6846 →

items.title: Solutions Architect - NLP and Machine Learning at Critical Mix (Perrysburg, OH)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=38, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=33}
items.content:
Solutions Architect - NLP and Machine Learning

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Industry: Integrated Marketing Solutions
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Critical Mix | Perrysburg, OH

Remote details

Office Location: Perrysburg, OH. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

reactjs
go
python
watson-conversation
php

Job description

   Critical Mix is looking for a Solutions Architect to work with our teams across the United States and is passionate on simplifying the complex with digital innovation.  Success in this position will require some unique knowledge in the areas of natural language processing services such as Watson and Lex as well as expertise in machine learning technologies. Of course, none of this really functions without an exceptional and intuitive BOT interface for the end user.

Responsibilities:

  • Take technical lead on the team in the ML/NLP domain and keep up with latest industry solutions.
  • Design, develop, validate and deploy proposed ML/NLP solutions both internal and client facing.
  • Innovate and build new features for our products including chatbots and virtual assistants.
  • Coaching and mentoring a team of diverse and talented software engineers.
  • Interfacing with senior management and stakeholders to define requirements and take the lead on operational and technical projects in a fast-paced environment.

Requirements

  • Advanced degree Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related area 
  • 3+ Years of experience building software products as an Architect
  • 1+ years ML/NLP domain experience.
  • Experience with Python or Go programming languages
  • Knowledge of JavaScript frameworks like ReactJS, React Native, AngularJS
  • Experience with Microservices and Resftul API’s
  • Familiarity with a major machine learning/deep learning frameworks a plus (Keras, Tensorflow, Torch, Spark-ML)
Apply now

About Critical Mix

Critical Mix provides easy access to highly-targeted global survey respondents, survey programming and data visualization services for market research and consulting firms. Driven by a passion for simplifying data collection, the team at Critical Mix is personally invested in giving clients the ultimate customer service experience.

Benefits

  • Health benefits
  • Flexible schedule
  • Great work/life integration
  • Empowerment
  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Competitive compensation
  • Remote location
  • Gym memberships

items.title: Solution Engineer (ID: PRSE01) at Open-Xchange GmbH (Nürnberg, Deutschland)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Solution Engineer (ID: PRSE01)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Collaboration Tools, Computer Software, Open-Source
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Open-Xchange GmbH | Nürnberg, Deutschland

Remote details

Office Location: Nürnberg, Deutschland. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

powerdns
dns
linux

Job description

Don’t just go to work. Thrive.
Here are people committed to openness, a rebellious business spirit and they have the will to revolutionize the market.

We are eMail
Worldwide companies like: 1&1, STRATO, Host Europe, NetCologne, network solutions / web.com and Rackspace use our "white label" products for eMail and collaboration.

Open people for an open source!
Join the force which works on products to support people in their daily digital life without sacrificing their personal freedom and protect their data.

Daily activities alternate between working on customer issues and actual "Professional Services for customer implementations (both on & off-site). As a Solutions Engineer (with a focus on PowerDNS) you will work closely with the PowerDNS development team, as well as other parts of Open-Xchange and Dovecot development, sales and Product Management teams form within the European Service team.

We think Support & Implementation is a great step into a promising career. We are specifically looking for employees willing to learn quickly while delivering great support and service. Keeping an eye towards growing within the Global Services department or into different roles in the larger Open-Xchange organisation. In other words, this position is a great opportunity for your personal development. There will be a close and intimate cooperation between PowerDNS and OX Professional Services regarding the  support, implementation and development roles.

Your passion / Your job

  • Implementation & Support of PowerDNS technology for our customers
  • Investigate and reproduce complex custom issues, test solutions, help implement fixes
  • Providing technical support during complex deployment projects and roll-outs
  • Evaluation of customer environment, creation of custom integration concepts, and writing SOWs for actual implementations.
  • Customer communication and managing (technical) relationship
  • Work closely with PowerDNS (including Open-Xchange and Dovecot) development, sales, and product management teams
  • Manage architecture, design and documentation for customer solutions & projects
  • Hands on training of customer’s administrators and support team

What do you bring to the table

  • Good knowledge of DNS technologies and solutions (Open source and commercial).
  • Knowledge and experience with PowerDNS is a bonus
  • Experience in system administration or support of Unix or Linux systems, ideally in the hosting/telco market.
  • In-depth knowledge of and demonstrated experience with Linux systems
  • Experience with System architecture and design (design and analysis of complex setups in heterogeneous environments). 
  • Good understanding of large, complex networking environments (IP, Anycast, Telco mobile and broadband networks, etc.)
  • Hands-on experience with Ansible, cloud technologies and databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redis and sqlite)
  • Knowledge of Lua script and/or C++ is a bonus.
  • Ability to work independently
  • Ability to travel international
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • multi-lingual candidates (in German, Dutch, French, Spanish or Italian) will get bonus points
  • Experience with mission critical systems
  • knowledge of large scale E-Mail systems is a bonus 

What do we offer

  • Training and personal development
  • Home Office and the opportunity to work from one of the many offices we define as the OX world
  • The latest in IT equipment
  • Flat hierarchies combined with "Open Door" policies
  • Personal development in a dynamic environment

Apply now

About Open-Xchange GmbH

Open-Xchange / Open people for Open source

With some 250+ employees Open-Xchange develops a Open-Source-Software addressing communication, collaboration and office-productivity worldwide. Sales are made through Internet service providers, hosting, telecommunication and cable providers, which offer their customers the Open-Xchange solution as SaaS (Software as a Service). More than 200 million users adopted Open-Xchange software for their private and business communications via partners such as 1 & 1, STRATO, Host Europe, NetCologne, network solutions / web.com and Rackspace.

The core offer is named OX App Suite with applications for processing e-mails, contacts and appointments, which can be extended by functions like: OX Drive for managing and synchronizing documents, images, photos and movies; OX Documents for text processing, spreadsheets and presentations and OX Guard for encrypting emails and files. Software from Dovecot and PowerDNS are complementing Open-Xchange's portfolio.

We want to constantly advance and are looking for people who have fun working with the latest technologies in an international team. There are locations in Hamburg, Bremen, Dortmund, Cologne, Olpe and Nuremberg as well as Finland, France, the Netherlands, Italy and Spain. International offices are in Tokyo, Sydney and Palo Alto which represents the distributed team in the USA.

If you are interested, please contact Jochen F. Schude for further information - or send us your paperless application with a cover letter including the job ID, tabular CV, certificates, salary request and the earliest possible date of entry by e-mail to recruiting at open-xchange.com.

Benefits

  • Homeoffice
  • Flache Hierarchien
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • Modernste Technik
  • Work-Live-Balance
  • Culture-Mixed

items.title: Architecte Solutions at CAPGEMINI FRANCE (Paris, France)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=15, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Architecte Solutions

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Industry: Automation, IT Consulting, Technology Consulting
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Private
Company: CAPGEMINI FRANCE | Paris, France

Remote details

Office Location: Paris, France. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

java
jee
esb
mom
soa

Job description

En pleine transformation digitale, les grands comptes du secteur Banque & Assurance font appel à l'entité FS SBU (Financial Services Strategic Business Unit) du groupe Capgemini. A Paris, Nantes ou Montpellier, les 1 300 talents de la FS s'appliquent à imaginer et réaliser des solutions novatrices, adaptées aux nouveaux enjeux de demain.

En tant qu'Architecte Solution H/F, vous avez participé à des projets de transformation. Outre votre connaissance des techniques et méthodologies, cela vous a permis de développer vos aptitudes relationnelles et votre leadership. Chez Capgemini, vous accompagnez les projets de nos clients en travaillant avec des interlocuteurs variés.

Vos missions :

- Accompagner les projets dans leurs différentes phases
- Participer au recueil des besoins et problématiques métiers et techniques
- Concevoir des solutions qui répondent aux exigences de performance, de robustesse, d'exploitabilité et de sécurité
- Définir et porter les architectures applicatives et techniques en assurant la traçabilité et la justification des choix
- Participer ou piloter la conception détaillée, la réalisation des solutions
- Avoir un rôle d'expert technique pour valider la faisabilité des projets
- Contribuer aux actions d'avant-vente
- Participer au développement de le la communauté des architectes Capgemini
- Faire progresser le positionnement et la reconnaissance technologique de Capgemini en tant qu'acteur majeur de la transformation Digitale des entreprises.
- Apporter votre valeur dans l'amélioration des outils et méthodes Capgemini
- Suivre et coacher des architectes juniors afin de garantir la qualité de notre delivery et de les épauler dans leur évolution professionnelle.

Diplômé d'un BAC+5 (Ecole d'ingénieur, Master 2 Système d'Information), vous maîtrisez les principales technologies et approches de l'architecture de SI (ESB, MOM, SOA, REST) ainsi que les problématiques associées (organisation dont agilité, devOps). Vous avez une expérience des solutions innovantes (microservices, RPA, IA, APIzation, Cloud...).

Apply now

About CAPGEMINI FRANCE

Fort de 50 ans d’expérience et d’une grande expertise des différents secteurs d’activité, le groupe accompagne les entreprises et organisations dans la réalisation de leurs ambitions, de la définition de leur stratégie à la mise en œuvre de leurs opérations. Capgemini, leader mondial du conseil, des services informatiques et de la transformation numérique, a réalisé un chiffre d'affaires de 12,7 milliards d'euros en 2017.

Notre vision
Pour Capgemini, ce sont les hommes et les femmes qui donnent toute sa valeur à la technologie. L’honnêteté, l’audace, la confiance, la liberté et l’indépendance d’esprit, la solidarité, la simplicité et le plaisir sont les valeurs fortes qui façonnent la manière dont nous répondons aux besoins de nos clients. Résolument multiculturel, le Groupe compte 200 000 collaborateurs présents dans plus de 40 pays.

Benefits

  • Contexte multiculturel
  • Misions diversifiées : clients d'envergure, tous secteurs d'activité
  • Ecole de formation : réseaux d'experts, certifications, Université...
  • Accord égalité professionnelle Hommes/Femmes
  • Accord Télétravail
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise

items.title: Senior Database / BI Developer at JBS Custom Software Solutions
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=2, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Database / BI Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Database Administrator
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: JBS Custom Software Solutions | No office location

Technologies

etl
sql-server
olap
ssas
powerbi

Job description

Required:

  • 5+ years experience with common Data Warehousing patterns                   
  • 5+ years experience with ETL processes and procedures              
  • Experience with optimizing and performance tuning SQL queries   
  • Experience with tabular models and solutions
  • Experience designing and development MOLAP and tabular cubes
  • Experience with SQL Server Analysis Services, SQL Server Reporting Services, SQL Master Data Services, SQL Data Quality Services                       
  • Experience with data visualization toolsets such as PowerBI and Kibana                   
  • Experience with Business Intelligence concepts and implementations                      
  • Experience with Azure                   
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating system environment                 
  • Ability to accurately estimate work                          
  • Strong communication skills                        

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with C#                          
  • Experience with MVC or other web development frameworks                     
  • Experience with NoSql databases such as MongoDB                         
  • Experience with service oriented architectures and webservices (REST/SOAP/etc)

JBS Benefits

  • Full-time employment with benefits
  • Work from home
  • Medical/Dental/Life/Disability
  • 401k with company match
  • Paid overtime
  • PTO and Company Holidays
Apply now

Benefits

  • Remote Work

items.title: Lösungsarchitekt - Solution Architect at Platform.sh
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=66, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Lösungsarchitekt - Solution Architect

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Manager
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Continuous Delivery, PaaS
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Platform.sh | No office location

Technologies

cloud
linux
symfony
drupal
amazon-web-services

Job description

Unsere Kunden brauchen Onboarding und Training, bevor sie den Platform.sh-Spaß meistern können. Können Sie atemberaubende und aufregende Tech-Demos liefern und die Feinheiten der Kommandozeilen-Tools erklären? Wir betreiben OEM PaaS-Services für bekannte Marken wie Magento Enterprise Cloud Edition und Sensio Cloud - können Sie uns helfen, diese dynamischen Softwareprodukte zu entwickeln und zu betreiben?

Sie berichten direkt an unseren Director of Customer Solutions und sind in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Teams für Vertrieb, Support, Engineering und Infrastruktur verantwortlich für den Verkauf und die proaktive Sicherstellung eines stabilen und sicheren Produkterlebnisses:

  • Anpassung des Produkts an die Anforderungen der potenzielle Kunden
  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Vertriebsteams für Produktdemos und Beantwortung technischer Fragen
  • Eingliederung und Bildung von Neukunden
  • Demonstration des Geschäftswissens unserer Kunden im Hinblick auf unsere Produktnutzung
  • Analyse der technischen Bedürfnisse der Kunden, um Beratungsleistungen vorzuschlagen und deren Anforderungen zu erfüllen.
  • Unterstützung unserer Großkunden bei der täglichen Nutzung unserer Produkte
  • Zusammenarbeit mit den Entwicklungsteams, wenn dies für die Produktverbesserung erforderlich ist.
  • sich regelmäßig mit unseren neuen Produktfeatures vertraut zu machen

Sie geben unseren Kunden einen ersten Eindruck von unserem Produkt und führen den Weg zu hoher Zufriedenheit in ihrer Produkterfahrung.

Was wir suchen

  • Nachgewiesene erfolgreiche Erfahrung im Umgang mit technischen Kundenbeziehungen in der Web-Branche
  • Nachweis der Fähigkeit, Kundenerwartungen erfolgreich mit der Produktkapazität abzugleichen
  • Umfangreiches Wissen über Architektur und Dienste von Webanwendungen (DNS, CDN, Webserver, Datenbanken, Cache-Layer usw.) und verteilte Systeme.
  • Umfangreiche Kenntnisse von Web-Entwicklungs-Workflows und vorhandenen Tools (Git, CI-Tools)
  • Kenntnisse gängiger Webanwendungen und Frameworks: Magento Ecommerce, Symfony, Drupal, eZ Platform oder Typo3 (viele unserer Kunden betreiben diese)
  • Kenntnisse über Cloud-Dienste (AWS, Azure)
  • Dynamik mit einem kühler Kopf
  • Ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten mit Englischkenntnissen und deutsche als Muttersprache.

Schön zu haben :

  • Mad Linux (Debian) skillz
  • Öffentliches Reden Erfahrung
Apply now

About Platform.sh

Wir sind ein Risikokapital finanziertes, preisgekröntes Team von Hardcore-Hackern, die die Art und Weise revolutionieren möchten, wie Entwickler und Agenturen Webanwendungen erstellen und bereitstellen. Wir sind meistens verteilt, aber wir treffen uns täglich im Cyberspace und gelegentlich in Paris, Frankreich. Wir schätzen Begeisterung, Teamgeist und den ständigen Wunsch, das persönliche Wissen zu erweitern und einen Beitrag für die Gemeinschaft zu leisten. Wir bieten eine multikulturelle, lockere und ausgeglichene Arbeitsumgebung. Kürzlich haben wir der Einführung der Magento Enterprise Cloud Edition und der Sensio Cloud im/mit Platform.sh-Technologie mitgeholfen.

Zu unsere Kunden zählen unter anderem Vivienne Westwood, der britische Modehändler Reiss, die Canadian Football League, der British Council, der Parc Asterix, Seloger.com, das deutsche Start-up Flixbus oder das südamerikanische El Universo.

Benefits

  • Work from home, wherever you are
  • Safe and friendly working environment
  • Stock options for everyone
  • Rest and recovery are essential to health and happiness; we get that

items.title: REMOTE Sr.Developer - strong AWS experience, Gluster/GlusterFS or AWS EFS at Surge

items.content:
REMOTE Sr.Developer - strong AWS experience, Gluster/GlusterFS or AWS EFS

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private
Company: Surge | No office location

Technologies

amazon-web-services
filesystems
aws-elasticfilesystem
glusterfs
linux
sysadmin

Job description

Surge Forward is looking for smart, self-motivated, experienced, senior-level consultants who enjoy the freedom of telecommuting and flexible schedules, to work as long-term, consistent (40 hrs/week) independent contractors on a variety of software development projects.

File System Developer - strong AWS experience, Gluster/GlusterFS or AWS EFS (elastic file system), strong in Linux, Ruby or PHP or Go

REQUIRED:File System Developer - strong AWS experience, Gluster/GlusterFS or AWS EFS (elastic file system), strong in Linux, Ruby or PHP or Go

* Must haves

    * Strong AWS experience

    * Gluster/GlusterFS or AWS EFS (Elastic File System)

    * Strong in linux

    * Ruby or PHP or Go

* Nice to Have

    * Actual linux systems programming - Needs to understand the OS in and out

    * Experience working with a Distributed File System 

Only candidates located in Canada and/ or the US can be considered at this time. Sorry, No Visas.

Resume must include the tech stack under each job and if you have Angular experience, please include what version of Angular you have coded in at each position.

For immediate consideration, email resume and include your cell phone number and start date: dsanderson@surgeforward.com

Apply now

About Surge

Surge is an onshore provider of custom web, cloud, mobile, digital, and desktop software development and consulting services to clients in every industry, from hot startups to Fortune 500 companies.

Founded in 2007, and listed on the Inc. 5000 list of America’s fastest growing companies for five straight years, Surge has successfully delivered hundreds of software products, apps, and solutions to its clients using a proven agile/scrum development process combined with an elite group of North American software professionals.

Simply put, Surge offers America’s best software engineers, on demand, at rates 30-50% less than the competition.

Benefits

  • Great Pay
  • Choose Your Hours
  • Work From Home
  • Work With Happy People
  • Zero Commute
  • See Your Family More
  • Travel While You Work
  • Software Provided

items.title: PHP + Laravel Engineer at High-Growth FinTech Company at Lenox Park Solutions LLC (Austin, TX)
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=75, embedded=0, frontend=24}
items.content:
PHP + Laravel Engineer at High-Growth FinTech Company

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Financial Technology, Investment Banking, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private
Company: Lenox Park Solutions LLC | Austin, TX

Remote details

Office Location: Austin, TX. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

php
laravel
vue.js
ubuntu
linux

Job description

Lenox Park Solutions is seeking a PHP Engineer with 2-5 years of commercial experience. As a PHP Engineer, you would work closely with our Development team to code and test functionality which will directly increase the scalability of Roundtables, our flagship product which will disrupt and revitalize the Asset Management industry. The junior developer will work directly with an experienced Senior PHP Engineer in helping to execute platform development, and will have the opportunity to grow within the organization as LPS expands it technical team. At LPS, we focus on accountability, proactive-ness, and creative thinking. Staff members retain the option to work remotely, as we are a goals-oriented team.

  • Requirements:
    • Professional experience on PHP, specifically with Laravel, VueJS/ReactJS, and Git, and preferably with Laravel Queues, Websockets, Amazon Web Services, and Linux (Ubuntu);
    • Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written experience with technical and non-technical audiences;
    • Ability to assess ongoing processes critically and recommend creative, thoughtful operational improvements;
  • Preferred Skills:
    • Understanding of Asset Management industry;
    • Business-oriented, highly analytical mind with a knack for accounting for both complex business and technical considerations simultaneously
Apply now

About Lenox Park Solutions LLC

Lenox Park Solutions LLC (LPS) is a FinTech firm focused on Asset Managers and Financial Institutions. Our mission is to enable the democratization of access to Institutional capital by using technology to match best-in-class Asset Allocators with the most talented Asset Managers. Our solutions will challenge entrenched traditional notions of who should be able to manage money, upending the staid model where pedigree and privilege drive capital allocation. Leveraging deep experience in investment banking and asset management, LPS licenses CRM solutions that emphasize networking and collaboration to manage Fundraising, Deal Pipeline, Business Development and Operations. LPS maintains offices in New York, NY and Austin, TX.

Benefits

  • Remote Office
  • Experienced Investment Professionals
  • Austin and New York Offices
  • Lean, Entrepreneurial Team

items.title: Ping Access - Remote,Identity and Access Management / IAM Solutions Ar
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Identity and Access Management / IAM Solutions Architect candidates will have experience with Ping Access. If no strong/current Ping Access experience it's a no-go. Candidates will ideally come from a software development background. We will entertain candidates from either end user or service provider backgrounds. This role is remote with travel so candidates can be based anywhere in the US. Must be US Citizens or Permanent Residents with easily understood English speaking skills.

Location - Virtual-Remote-Telecommute - 35% travel
Starting salary $100,000 to $120,000+ per year, Also part of the comp package are full time health benefits along with significant career progression opportunity.

US citizens or Permanent Residents only

This is a permanent position working for a leading Cyber Security Solution provider servicing large enterprise organizations and US Government agencies.

In this Identity and Access Management Solutions Architect position you will be the primary customer interface and technical authority with regard to IAM products and solutions.

Duties and Responsibilities
-Provides technical design and consulting services on (IAM) Identity and Access Management (IAM) products
-Provides customer specific though leadership and solution construction including installations of Identity and Access Management (IAM) products for User life-cycle management, Identity and Access Governance, Automated Provisioning, (SSO) Single Sign-On, Federation, and Privileged Account Management
-Enhances existing systems by analyzing business objectives, preparing an action plan and identifying areas for modification and improvement
-Creates customer level documentation specific to deployment of IAM products
-Creates knowledge articles for corporate website related to IAM

-Provide regular feedback to the Professional Services Director to guide systems integration methodology and packages service development

Technical Experience and Qualifications
-Experience with Ping Access
-Lead customer-focused discussions and interact with our customers as the primary technical authority for an engagement
-Ability to present project solutions to clients, manage client expectations, and implement and deliver solutions
-Become a subject matter expert with IAM products and concepts
-Web Application security
-Software Security
-HTTP and related technologies
-Database/Directory integration
-x509 Certificates
-Windows, Unix, Linux
-Experience with IAM products: Radiant Logic, Sailpoint, Centrify, ForgeRock, Ping Access, Ping Identity / Ping ID/ PingID, Ping Federate, IBM, Okta, Oracle, RSA, simeio
-Federated Identity and Single Sign-On
-Access Management and API Gateways
-SAML, WS-Federation, OAuth, OpenID Connect, and/or SCIM standards
-RADIUS and/or KERBEROS
-APIs (SOAP, XML, REST, JSON)
-Social APIs including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.
-User Directory (Active Directory OpenLDAP, OpenDJ, etc.)
-Java and/or .NET development
-Amazon's AWS services (i.e. VPCs, SES, RC2, R3, Route 53, Cloud Formation, etc.)

  • provided by Dice Ping Access, IAM, Solution Architect

items.title: Looking for Salesforce - Solution Architect - Remote

Location: Connecticut, 25% travel, mostly remote.

800 hours estimated

App-dev experience not as a developer but as business analyst / solution architect / some project mgr experience a plus.

Consulting experience with reputable outfit

Solution Architect experience, demonstrated recent experience in the role of Salesforce Solution Architect, where business analyst skills were deployed specifically over the Salesforce platform.

-- Best RegardsVijay Intuites LLC 4640 Valais Ct, Ste 101A, Johns Creek, GA 30022Direct: |Fax: Email: |

items.content:
Gravitational (YS S15) | Devops, Solutions Engineer | Toronto, Oakland | ONSITE REMOTE https://gravitational.com

Gravitational, systems & cloud startup in Oakland and Toronto, is looking for ambitious and talented people. We are well-funded by fantastic Silicon Valley investors. We are an experienced team: we founded Mailgun[1] which was acquired by Rackspace, we created Vulcand[2] and some other cool stuff at Rackspace and are authors of Teleport[3], Telekube[4] and Teleconsole[5]

  * Solutions Engineer (Terraform, Linux, Kubernetes, Go, Ansible)
We are looking for an experienced systems engineer who can code and can focus on our customers success - making sure our products solve their problems well. This job involves a lot of customer interactions, support, coding in Go, devops and systems engineering.

Locations: Toronto, Oakland, Remote

Details: https://gravitational.com/careers/solutions-engineer/

Contact: jobs@gravitational.com

items.title: Holochain Developer - Cryptography, Security, Identity
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
at Holo: 
We are on a world-changing mission to build a new, regenerative economy and a more human internet.

Holo is a distributed cloud platform that enables our community to earn cryptocurrency by hosting truly peer-to-peer applications on their own mini servers. Holo is built on Holochain, our new open source, post-blockchain framework that is faster, massively scalable and 10,000x cheaper.

Following our successful ICO, we are rapidly expanding and are looking for high-level Developers to help us build out our Holochain app.

This is a perfect opportunity for a hands-on talent professional who wants an exciting challenge, working in a highly entrepreneurial environment on a world-changing mission.

Job Description:
The Holo team will be working on many of the following activities:

  • Signed Service Logs
  • Anon/Web gateway services
  • Virtual Source Chain Mgt
  • Web browser key management
  • Collect & share peer performance metrics
  • HQuery for hashing/signing, etc.
  • User Centric container management
  • P@P routing/NAT
  • Calculating Host Performance Levels
  • DNS on CDN - JavaScript service workers
  • Sub browser to CDN w/domain certs
  • UI for app providers
  • UI for admins
  • Log analytics for fraud detection
  • Scaling and load tests
  • HoloPort cloud service

And much more…

What we offer:

  • Starts with a 3 Month Contract to Hire (dependent on country and employment laws)
  • Generous salary (National Currency or ETH)
  • Generous bonus program (HOT & Holo fuel)
  • BYOE with Equipment Reimbursement
  • Remote work
  • Regular team meetings (video and in person)
  • Agile/Scrum
  • Pair Programming Opportunities
  • Collaborative and Inspiring Culture
  • Creating Benefits Programs based on wants and needs of the team
  • Flexible Work Schedules and Vacation

Salary range:
USD $90k - $140k
